docs.title: Home
docs.text: UI Module is a stand-alone ModuleScript that was initially created for Minigames.

docs.title: UiModule.new(): UiModule
docs.text: This method is used the intialize a new UiModule.

docs.title: UiModule:IntializeButton(button: GuiButton): nil
docs.text: Adds animations for when the cursor hovers over, and clisk on a button.

docs.title: UiModule:IsWindowVisible(window: Window | Frame): boolean
docs.text: Returns whether a frame is open or close (positions in config) If a frame is mid-animation, it will return true

docs.title: UiModule:CloseAllWindows(): nil
docs.text: Calls UiModule:CloseWindow on all windows with the window attribute set to true in PlayerGui.Main.

docs.title: UiModule:OpenWindow(window: Window | Frame): nil
docs.text:
Opens a window and plays the opening sound in [TODO: put in config] sound service

If the window has the window attribute set to true, it will call UiModule:CloseAllWindows

docs.title: UiModule:IntializeWindow(window: Window): nil
docs.text: Adds the window attribute to window. Calls UiModule:IntializeButton on window.Close. When window.Close is clicked, UiModule:CloseWindow is called.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text: UI Module is for creating animated buttons, windows and tabs.

docs.title: Setting Up
docs.text: UI Module is a standalone ModuleScript. UI Module can only be used on the client-side. (For the UI)
